name: Cheryl Wade
text: Wow just wow. I purchased a home on CR 142. I was informed I had to get the meter number. First off the meters for the whole road are at the end of the road in a group. Because the meters were full of water I was told to scoop the water out with a cup!  I'm sure they have on record which meters goes to which houses. I'm sure they sent previous bills to the previous land owner. After all they are the ones who laid the meters and pipes in the ground to charge people for water! I had to do their job! Unprofessional! Very Unprofessional! I paid a deposit for their services. Which they did not perform. It's sad I have to give a 1 star rating. They don't deserve the 1 star. Incompetent staff!

name: Carol Nix
text: I posted a review a couple of months ago, but it appears it disappeared!!!???  I noticed that several reviews stated "have no business there" or "never been there", but gave FAVORABLE reviews!  What is that about?  As a customer/member of this co-op since 1988, I can affirm through personal experience that the many of the policies & procedures enacted by the current Board of Directors are not only impractical, but also illegal.  They are imposing a great hardship on those who are not fortunate enough to own homes by requiring the tenants to pay a deposit 2 to 3 times the amounts required in other municipalities... in addition to requiring that the landlord sign a contract accepting responsibility to pay the unpaid debts of those who rent.  This action, along with many others, are in violation of the By-laws as well as the Alabama Code, and is discrimination against a class of people who are renters.  A member of this Board has stated that they "can do anything we want to do!"  Air, food AND WATER are our most valuable possessions in this life as they sustain our life.  We must have "trustees" of our water who protect ALL of us in a fair,  reasonable, and lawful way.

name: Vicki Griffin
text: This is a poorly run business.  First they have a copy of the By laws that are not correct.  They started that the quorum amount has been changed from 20% to 15% Alabama non profit corporate law states can only raise the percentage but cannot lower it. If they had an attorney that was worth a flip he would know that.  Also, a nonprofit is not to be micromanaged by the board members.  Also, there are resolution from 1993 that the manager is responsible for all the hiring and termination of employees.  NOT THE BOARD MEMBERS.  Also need to check the IRS web site on nonprofit corporations, you have to show financials for every day that you have refused this it's a $20.00.  I believe the first time they were asked for was September 2016.  Oh and by the way, this is against the Board members not the cooperation.  You are personal liable. Everyone of you since Aug 2016.  You do not follow the Article of Incorporation nor the Bylaws. You refused the members 2 times a request for special meeting.  IRS states you have to provide us this meeting.  Uh oh   You are in noncompliace of the IRS 501(c)3 rules and regulations for tax exempt status.  If you had a descent Secretary she would have researched these matters.  Oh, but when she started Jesse had to show her to get on the internet.

name: Larry Keene
text:
City of Bessemer
Bessemer Utilities
P.O. Box 1246, Bessemer AL. 35020

Dear Madam:
I am writing to dispute a billing error in the amount of $1,148.05 on my account. This amount is egregious and boldly inaccurate, because I have not resided at the above property since July 31, 2016. It is in your billing responsibilities to have contacted me prior to 3 years after the delinquency.
It also states in your Bessemer Utilities Code of Ordinance , Code 1995; Ord. No. 2425; Section #110-51 Billing; line (h) and (i)
(h)  A notice will be mailed no earlier than two business days after the due date advising the customer that their bill has not been paid. This notice will advise the customer that the late charge has been added and that an additional ten days has been granted.
(i)  If the bill is not paid, service will be discontinued. Such notice shall contain instructions on how to apply for a hearing if the bill is disputed or if the customer is in financial distress and unable to pay the bill. If the customer fails to respond either with payment or by notifying the utility, disputing the amount of the bill, or by advising the office of the customer's inability to pay, service will be discontinued as scheduled.
I have printed confirmation from USPS showing that I had a change of address active with priority forwarding  from 8/31/16-8/31/17. During this time I never received ANY correspondence from Bessemer Utilities.
I also find it Unbelievable and Incredulous that Bessemer Utilities would allow a customer 11 months of service without payment, prior to disconnecting service. Especially when your code of ordinance states otherwise.
Meanwhile you have been billing the current owner of the residence, an acquaintance of mine, as well.
I am requesting that the error be corrected, that any finance and/or charges related to the disputed amount including my $300+ deposit be credited back to me immediately.

text: I wish I could give them a BIG FAT ZERO!!! Over charge their customers, customer service is TERRIBLE, billing/payments needs to be modernized!! Brings me back to how things were in the 60's and I wasn't even born back then. Its a shame how they rob citizens and charge people what they want! I don't understand how you can have a sewer bill and water $99 a piece and light bill is just as worse!!! So corrupted!!! Getting out of this city ASAP!!!!!!!

name: dcasey
text:
Since their website says they open at 8:00 AM, I called at 8:05 AM and was told by a very rude answering service operator that it took them 10-15 minutes after opening to be able to take calls and that I should call back in 15 minutes. I called back and the lady who answered my call was kind and answered my questions. I was hoping I could do what I needed over the phone or over the internet but was told I had to come in.
Once there, the female employee, in the middle cubicle inside the wood doors who assists new customers, was extremely rude, slow and incompetent. She had no customer service skills at all. She gave us two documents showing how much we were being "robbed" for a deposit with two different amounts. The cashier had to go back to her to get a correct amount.
To top it all off, this rude female had several printouts hanging on her wall with "Christian" sayings and bible references. Yet, she completely ignores how Christ treated others. She as well as her boss should be fired. It is a shame that employees are allowed to treat customers so rudely!

name: Vanessa skripko
text: It was 387.93 to set up water electric and sewer. It's  not like Alabama power where you can pay on the first bill, the deposit has to be paid before they will turn it on. The cashiers are rude and once you get behind the double doors to set up service, they just get more rude. I was told I had to have my landlord call. When he did they had no idea why he was calling and what was going on so he came in to talk to them. They still had no idea what was going on and why he was there so I came up there to look the mean lady who kept taking personal cell phone calls while "helping" me in the eyes and say what the heck does my landlord need to be here for. She said because she had to make sure the previous tenants didn't live there. Lol lady you made a copy of the lease that said they don't live there. She denied scanning my lease and ID into the computer system. Well I had to make a big stink and call her a liar but they found it. No one should be pushed to the point of having to throw a fit. After the other somewhat nicer lady looked through my stuff she scanned she told us the landlord didn't need to be there and finished my paperwork so I could pay at the front. I need to charge them for gas taking up my entire day I had to wait 20-45 minutes each time after signing in. They got their lunches brought to them had me waiting while they ate it. Told my landlord he was supposed to say denada when she said gracias. He does speak Spanish but gosh why would she insist he speak it when he speaks perfect English. Can we get an automated system instead of having to deal with the rude ladies? I don't know why the are so mean and rude and this was to everybody who walked in the door. Except for the guy who brought them food and the lady who was taking personal phone calls. She was really nice to the person on the other end of the cell phone. Had to compose herself back into angry lady when she turned her chair so she could "help" me again.

name: Donna T
text: Awful. They clearly do not care about their customers. My bills were too high to pay, so called them to get my meter checked. They came and said that they would recommend us a plumber. They never did! There’s a fee to pay online whether it be an E Check or a Credit Card. Making payments online is very inconvenient. This place needs to be shut down!

name: Tisha C
text: I have never seen people that work for city be so slow!! Not only that,  they don’t do their job and when you call them on it they call you a lie and say we will see but it’s gonna cost you $60.

text: I had to live in Bessemer for over 3 years putting up with these guys. They do not do their job in the office. They never answer the phone. When you're next in line in the phone suddenly you ate 4th in line instead of first. Most of the employees in the office don't know their job. They are feather bedding with their GOD Uncle or "cousin' KENNETH GULLEY - our Mayor who can't be bothered either. One day I hope all of these people lose their thumbs..for keeping them up their asses instead of doing the right thing. My advice move to a community that isn't serviced by these dogs. I finally did.

THEIR DEPOSITS ARE INSANE, HAVE TO PAY TWO SEPARATE DEPOSITS ONE FOR WATER AND ONE FOR SEWER AT $100 EACH. THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE PEOPLE ARE STUPID, RUDE AND UNHELPFUL. THEIR RATES ARE THE HIGHEST I HAVE EVER PAID IN ANY STATE I HAVE LIVED IN. I THINK THEY ARE NOT ONLY CORRUPT BUT THEY ACCESS LATE FEES WHEN IT'S THEIR MISTAKE/ I WISH I DIDN'T HAVE TO USE THIS HORRIBLE COMPANY

When it comes to jacked up rates. Deposits that are meant to make you feel raped and excessive fees I'm super pissed. Can't wait till my lease is up. Bye Bessemer

text: During an outage I told the csr that someone in the home was on breathing machines and needed power and she said she didn't know when it would be on.  The correct thing to do would have been gather addresses from anyone with similar circumstances and correspond and coordinate along side their tech to make sure that life threatening power issues were resolved first and foremost

text: This is the worst business I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with.  I have had to call each month to remind them to bill me if they want any money.  They have made me reopen my account twice, and I'm always on hold for at least 20 minutes.

name: S Johnson
text: As with the other reviewers, Bessemer Utilities needs to get up to date.  Bill Pay is so outdated and to pay via phone you have to wait almost an hour to get someone on the phone.  I sent an email to Bess Util directly with no response.

name: Michelle Gordon
text: not a number to reach them after hours with an emergency . Water pipe broke at meter after it had been upgraded three days ago. Flooded yard.  Had to call 911 to call the water company . Dispatch called them 4 times.

name: Joel Quebec
text: If anyone happens have Alabama Power as a service, BU will happily also charge you for the same service. Make sure you don't accidently have both of them reading your meter and charging you.

name: John Knab
text: Rude is an understatement. Fire everyone and start over on your customer service team. They are defensive and abrupt. Birmingham utilities are a breathe of fresh air; Bessemer needs to be trained by the Birmingham utility teams.

name: Barry Mister
text: Extreme hold times, very rude, down right argumentative and confrontational. Perfect example of why monopolies are bad. I have had to call for days in a row at times to reach a human. Their systems are antiquated and difficult to use for payment services. Their identity verification process is weak and leaves customers vulnerable to identity theft. I have never once called this location and had anything other than a negative experience. How is it possible for an essential public utility to operate so horribly and to the detriment of the community which it is obligated to serve. I believe bessemer electric should be placed under the control of a state review board until it can be reorganized to effectively perform its duties to the public.

name: Daniel Freeman
text: Horrible. Something needs to be done. Better business bureau needs to know about this, everyone please report them. If we all report them maybe something will change.

name: Tewanda Williams
text: The staff is very rude, slow to assist anyone and they do not answer the phone.  I called the office while I was sitting in the lobby and the woman actually stated to me "its not her turn to answer the phone and the girl who suppose to answer didnt come in today."

name: Catie Rice
text: CAN WE GET A STATE AUDIT OF THIS PLACE!?!  The most corrupt unprofessional mess of a utility company I have ever dealt with, and my husband was in the military for 18 years!    We have got 2 paper bills in 8 months.  We had to pay late fees because I did not realize we did had not received a bill to pay.  I accepted to fault in that, and called to make sure we got a bill, or would get an email notification or etc.  They began sending our bill, and probably still are sending our bill to another person in another city!!!  Now fortunately I have a reminder set up, and go online to that so  called website to look up our bill.  I do have to pay an extra 3 a month to pay it that way.  You would think that the website would at least be up to date since you are having to pay 3 every time a payment is made.  I have never had such horrible experiences with ANY company in my life.  I too had the "pleasure" of going to the office.  It is a joke!  I would love to have these jobs.  They seem to move at a snails pace and can only say "no" or "i dont know." They do not exert any effort to be helpful, I dont know who is in charge of that place but obviously they have someone from the state utility commission in their back pocket because no company, utility or otherwise, could still be operating LEGALLY with the crooked practices that this company obviously prides its self in doing out in the open with no concern of consequences!

name: Tiffani Roy
text: VERY rude employees. Kept interrupting every time I tried to speak. Was put on hold for long periods of time, multiple times. Was all but called a liar. This place is a joke.

name: Meaghan Johnson
text: Worst service ever. Waited 40 minutes to be called back for somwone to help us. We were the only people in the room. Everyone was on their phones, talking to eachother and not paying any attention what so ever . I made it clear we were here and lady looked at us and just continued talking . Man came in and asked how long we have been waiting and said "oh hell no , I'm not waiting 40 minutes for this" and left. They finally looked at us and said " have you been waiting ?"  I said yes and she was like oh .  She was on Facebook the whole time .is it that hard to Do your job?

name: WoodKrafters Construction
text:
Water is off, been off most of the day. It's now 7:30 pm, we need showers, to water animals. I've called but they said they do not know when the water will be on. Yes I pay my bill.
I'm a certified plumber myself, I've repaired water mains. Never once did it take us this long. Also if water was to be off for more then one hour we would put in a bypass to ensure customers have water while we made our repair. But not Oxford water works. I've got to go to a hotel for the night so we have got water. No this is not the first time this has happened. Last time we went without water for 22 hours. If I don't pay my bill I bet they would be right out to cut me off. Oxford water works has been unreliable for me. Since I'm not leaving Oxford I will be drilling a well and getting off Oxford water. Will be calling tomorrow for them to read water meter for final bill.

name: Alabama Fish
text: Great people and a well run water department. My water has never been shut off, nor have I had a problem with the employees because I’m nice to them. I pay my water bill, unlike some people in the reviews. Don’t mind them, they complain about a late fee for not paying there bill, and try to get it taken off. Anyhow, water tastes great, despite the people saying it’s disgusting. Nothing shady goes on. They follow state regulations. If they didn’t, they wouldn’t exist.

They destroyed lines connecting my internet and all I was told to do is call ATT. My family with school starting this week will be out of service for 5days and I will have to pay the bill for the ATT service.

text: Every time I've called with a question, the people have been really great and helpful on the phone. I can't say I've had any major problems - just a few missing e-bills - turns out it was a system error. But for everyday questions, they have all been wonderful.

name: Camas
text: Can't imagine anyone complaining about the pricing of the water.  The bill is in line with small towns where I have lived and much less than other regions or big cities.  The people I have dealt with at the Water Authority have been nothing but gracious.

name: Teetrice Davis
text: This company is illegal. My cut off date was the,12th. I paid the bill on the 11th. They never came to cut it off because the bill was satisfied and they still charged a 40 reconnect fee for a service that was never disconnected. This has to be an illegal practice. Her explanation was it was satisfied after 430 pm. Mind you, my water bill averages less than the reconnect fee.

name: Shawn Pair
text: There are some nice people, but there is this one lady who is EXTREMELY rude, everytime I call.

name: Tim O'Brien
text: MINIMUM water/sewer bill totals right at $70? Seriously?! Really?!? That completely sucks! I've had ELECTRIC bills lower than that before.

name: Nicholas Nicholas
text: Price gouging water prices is the norm for this department.  Harvest MONROVIA ranks as some of the highest water bills in the state if not in the south given the lack of transparency with this department.  Sticker shock is common among many people I have spoken with.  The Board meets during business hours , 1pm, do that attendance and complaints is at a minimum.  Rates will go up each year ,as shown on their website, yet there are no capital improvement projects at all that are advertised.  If your a developer , it’s even worse, tapping into water/sewer lines for a subdivision will cost you hundreds per home. God forbid that you don’t develop the subdivision, they will keep your money for not even lifting a finger.  Highway robbery at its best.  My question is , where does all the money go?

name: Mark Austin
text: This place needs a course in customer service. The people are rude and very matter of fact with you. I would rather collect rain water and use it than continue to use this business . I paid my bill they still cut off water and wanted to charge a fee of twice the amount of the bill! I can not stand poor customer service. A change needs to come quick to this business.

name: Reviews By Mrs.
text: The level of customer service at Harvest Water is zero. I would have given them 1 star, but the water is fine. The problem really is just with the "service" people in the front and that answer the telephone. They almost go out of their way to be rude.

name: CeeCee s
text: Called to ask for help about the sewer and lady who answered the phone was slightly rude and gave me no help or information at all. She just said "thats just something you'll have to figure out" CLEARLY THATS WHY I WAS CALLING!

name: Justice Writer
text: This company is simply an offshoot of Huntsville Utilities with the exact same bad manners from employees and the exact same ability to cheat consumers except that Huntsville Utilities charges the consumer $40.00 if a door-knocker for a soon coming disconnect if forthcoming and Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority charges the consumer $40.00 simply if they run late. So, once asked why can't they knock on the doors of the consumers whose water they turn-off, consumers are told that this company does not have time to do that; but they do have time to cut off water in over "300" homes in the city of Harvest every single month. A couple of months ago, a consumer's water was intermittently cut off and payment was not due.  When the consumer called, Cheryle answered very rudely with, "Hey" as though she wanted to verbally assault the consumer who was understandably upset about the trickling of no faucet water coming out. For over 10 minutes no water came out of the consumers spigot. When the water did resume, it was brown similar to the water of Michigan state consumers and the household members have been ill every since with bleeding, exhaustion and the like and the household members don't even drink the water from the faucet which could possibly and reasonably lead to death. However, when their pets do, the pets start to make hacking sounds and inadvertently throw-up. Therefore, as a test for water poisoning and tampering the consumer put a specimen into a water bottle with faucet water and watered the outside plants only to find that the plants died. By the way, once the consumer called about the water and was told that someone would be sent out to "blow-out the pipes". The consumer feels that Harvest-Monrovia Water has purposely, wantonly, maliciously and continuously tampered with the water of the consumers in Harvest are being subjected to volitional acts of systematical and un-feathered bad acts against them by Harvest-Monrovia Water  Authority with malice and aforethought. Thanks a million.

name: Decide America
text:
This entity, Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority, deserves a rating of a 0. This is yet another anti-melanated citizen company that is likely a closet ALEC member, if not an open one. They are monsters of inequality. It’s likely that the split of Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority from Huntsville Utilities was due to a need for both entities to further reign in the manipulation of those who are often overlooked. To add insult to injury, it is clear that entities such as Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority hate melanated people and will do anything to assist that person in Washington, DC to push melanated people into the woods much like the Australian Aborigines have been pushed into the wilderness. Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority is definitely not at all for the majority of the citizens of Harvest, Alabama who are the majority of the populaces residing in the area. . Thus, due to astute hatred, in America, and particularly in the South, brutal gouging, absorbent taxation without representation, as well as over-pricing by stores such as the Publix located on Highway 53 engage in hate crimes against many melanated residents. These illegal acts are unconscionable undertakings that have become strongholds. Yet, it is hurting the pocketbooks of the residents. Moreover, utility companies like Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority along with their partners in crime, Huntsville Utilities, are major players in manipulating, harassing, and causing economic hardship to the majority of the people in the Harvest neighborhood.  Somewhere between 100-400 residents have their water disconnected by Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority every month and in doing so, most residents are not in a position to pay the bill along with the absorbent, unfair and illegal fees.  For example, at least Huntsville Utilities employee will knock on the person’s door or leave a door tag advising the resident to pay the bill. Sure, everyone gets a bill and is responsible to pay it in a timely manner. However, life happens and would it hurt to hand a door tag on the door? Apparently this would hurt their evil intentions because the fee will be charged even if the payment is made the day before the disconnect after 4:30 p.m. Still, there is a fee for the disconnection of the service even if the disconnect doesn’t take place for Monrovia Water Authority. On the other hand, Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority simply robs the resident to no end. For instance, the average water bill in Harvest, Alabama is about, let’s say, $30.00 and if the bill is not paid by the date on the reminder pink card, there is a $40 fee plus a 10% of the bill penalty. On top of that, once the non-knocking worker turns off the water of the resident, there is not only the $40.00 fee; but also an after hour fee if the resident calls after 4:30 p.m. c.s.t. to pay the unreasonable bill. Also, it doesn’t matter if the resident pays Online or over the phone, there is still a fee. But, Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority doesn’t keep credit card digits on file. Thank GOD for that because Heaven only knows what could happen. Nevertheless, in order to put a type of payment authorization on file, a resident would need to print off an Online form, complete it with the bank number as well as he routing bank information and. Then, the resident can mail the form in or or bring it in. Either way, it is a grave inconvenience for many neighbors to do any extra duties, especially the ones who are older, incapacitated or somehow restricted. Moreover, most residents are better off not ever putting a credit card on file since there is so much fraud, tampering and commingling of funds.
This review could go on and on with instances of bad practices from the likes of entities like Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority et al However, just beware of such predatory practices by companies such as Harvest-Monrovia Water Authority and speak up for those who are unable to speak up for themselves before you are not able to speak at all™.

text: I'm confused as to why even if you don't use a certain amount of water, you still have to pay the minimum fee... Why can't we only pay for what we use

name: William Simmons
text: This company sucks! They're just a bunch of crooks! I've been paying $90 a month for my bill and I'm a  single guy living in a small house.  They make up fees and services and cut you off if you don't pay. Something has to be done about this monopoly. Customer service sucks too. Bunch of crooked a**holes.

name: Teresa Wilson
text: I truly wish I could give 0 stars.  The customer service at HMWA is beyond reprehensible.  Namely, there is an employee named Julie who is perhaps the meanest woman alive.  She is RUDE, RUDE, RUDE.  Sadly, her superiors know this yet they do nothing about it.  I emailed them, they responded, even acknowledged there's an issue with this employee but still nothing has been done.  Her behavior hasn't changed one bit.  She keeps treating customers poorly over and over again.  This is the problem when you're dealing with a monopoly like HMWA.  Where else can we get our water?  We have to use them so in turn they feel they can treat their customers however they choose.  Probably their crowning grace is a lady there named Cherita.  She is an absolute jewel.  I would suggest if you need anything from HMWA try to deal with Cherita.  She is a kind persona and her customer service skills are definitely a 10+.  The other employees are just average, depending on the day and how they feel.  I guess Julie is their measuring stick.  Back in April, I made myself a promise and that was I would treat Julie the same way she treats me.  If she's rude, and 9.9/10 times you can count on her being rude, I'm rude to her.  If she attempts to cut me off when I'm speaking, I talk over her.  If she bites, I bite back.  She deserves every single bad thing I could say about her and more.  Her behavior is despicable and I have to admit, I do not like this lady.  She definitely gives HMWA a bad name. If you are moving here make sure that you take a picture of your meter before they rip you off.  I have no proof that my meter read something different than what they said so I ended up having to pay them.  My water bill has not been over $30 since so I have no clue how they figured I could have used $300 in three weeks.

My water got cut off just yesterday Due do not making a payment for two months As it  Should I have no complaints with paying the bill for the water I’ve used.my issue is people are having trouble paying their bill during a crisis I think it would be pretty evident it would be very difficult to pay an additional $75 reconnection fee tacked on to whatever large bill someone may have and they have no issue giving out that extra charge. during normal situations and I get to work every day sure it’s my fault. But when I’m struggling as is I don’t need an additional almost hundred dollar bill added to my already $300 backed up water bill. And also to the way they talk to you on the phone you would think I haven’t paid child support in a year To the person I’m talking to directly. But that’s the norm in our society today. So fair warning
Pandemic or no pandemic you don’t pay you get shut down with an additional reconnection fee. Thanks city water always looking out for the customer. I’ve got more to say but not enough time so I’ll leave it at this if someone’s a first time being disconnected from the water grid I think y’all should have a one time reconnection wave instead of hitting them  with that hard fine.

text: I have been a customer for nearly 10 years and I have made my payment on time, every month, for over 100 straight months. I recently forgot to pay my January bill. This is the worst example of a company doing business that I have ever seen. Not only was my account not in “serious default” as it wasn’t even a month late, but to send that to a long time paying customer is just plain rude.   I am not even sure why we pay $115 (nearly $1500 a year) for your service. You provide one thing and it’s not that expensive. Unfortunately I have no other option but it should be expected that a utility company not completely rip off customers. And if you are, DO NOT send me a notification like this again or I will make it my personal mission to ruin this company’s name (doing a pretty good job on your own as evidenced by the 38 google ratings averaging 1.1 out of 5 stars). name: The Triple M
text: We Shelby county homeowners must have some of the skunkiest, nastiest,  most terrible waste water in the nation, to be charged these rates as if it's nuclear sewage ! How they can charge such amazing rates to offset their overhead costs is beyond me... except why would you build all these homes on a sewer pump basin ? The one I inherited works sometimes, then doesn't for days, then is fine for a few weeks until  a power surge. Stupidest idea to have to rely on this system to wash hands, do laundry, do dishes, shower.... it just does what it wants & leaves you stuck with plugged up tubs, sinks, toilets, & washers. My advice is to write to some higher ups, or just get out from under any home with this system. It's an evil system run by incompetent fools who want to pass their losses on to you, then double it to earn huge profits.

name: Maya M
text: We recently moved and unfortunately have no other option than to use this company. Sewer charges are 3x higher than water costs... this is robbery

name: Thomas Price
text: This is an immoral company that seems to be dedicated to ripping off those who can least afford to pay.  Let this be a warning to those commissioners and council people who are considering selling a publicly owned water system or sewage system to SWWC!  Rates in our area in Alabama (one of the poorest states in the nation) skyrocketed from $33 a month to over $112 a month (a flat fee that only includes sewer - water is about $40 to $60 a month from a different company) in just a few years.  Late fees are over 10% a month.  If you can't afford to pay, expect a bill in the thousands in a very short time.  Think about it ... 10% of $112 compounded every month with another $112 added in a monthly ongoing basis with late fees accruing on that as well.  You end up with people that already live at poverty levels owing thousands and being foreclosed on or having to file bankruptcy, their credit ruined, etc!   Imagine that you lived in a trailer park where you your rent was around $300 a month.  Not counting other utilities, you have to pay $112 a month just the same as a person living in the biggest mansion in Birmingham!  Plus you end up owing thousands in late fees and back bills if you don't pay in a timely manner! SWWC is a monopoly as well - you can't put in a septic tank, and any residence that is eligible to be hooked up to them has to pay the rate - whether you live there, use their services, etc.

Somebody's pockets are getting fatter from our hard-earned money.  On top of it all, is that they bill in advance for service yet to be provided, which you must pay to avoid disconnect

I guess they just know they can screw you over because your back is to the wall. What else are you going to do? Not have running water or sewer?

They have horrible customer service. Someone at the county or state level needs to address these issues. But when your the monopoly and people have no other choices but to use you I guess you have people right where you want them.  If you have an issue it’s never their fault even if it was.
Someone needs to get ahold of the people who run things down here. That’s why nobody is like oh let’s move to Mobile. It’s because the water Dept. and the Health Dept. and the city is ran like a 3 ring circus!

text: It’s a struggle to pay them every single month. They’re awful. I hate living in Mobile simply because of MAWSS.

name: Miguel Sanchez
text: Customer service is very poor.  No follow-through, nor sense of ownership in resolving issues.  This is what happens with monopolies and customers don’t have options.

name: Ahmed Al-Dossari
text: They charged me the same price for different amounts of water used.

name: Bryan and rebecca STRICKLAND
text: Liars and crooks

name: Super Fly
text: The water supply is contaminated. Don't drink, or bath in it! That reads like a act of terrorism because it is!

name: jamie nguyen
text: Mawss has the most impossible website to navigate online payments in the entire world. When you call for assistance they are rude 99% of the time rude. Connecting service is a nightmare as any other routine service like connection, bill payment, or disconnection. They need some competition.

name: Richard Shelton
text:
Motto should be,.."We don't value our customers or their needs
,  especially in these trying times."

name: Joshua Lingerfelt
text: They provide water and generally fix outages pretty fast. I think they are the last  company left in Alabama that does not take debit or credit cards in the office. Very inconvenient.

name: Wanda Olinger
text: WWBD is charging me double😡 No water leaks. No nothing... Is there not anything that can be done. Maybe a class action lawsuit. Anyone wanting to follow suit with this lets meet.

name: Jonathan Guinn
text: 3 months of double charges during a pandemic. We have no leaks, and the meter seems to be working fine. Can’t get them out to check the problem, even after contacting them 3 different times.

name: Kenny Bryant
text: I don't know how this group got so highly rated, but it obviously wasn't real customers. They won't take cards at all don't particularly care for checks and have no way to auto-pay accept for certain customers in certain areas. They will disconnect your service for any small amount , charge you for what wherever they want and you will fight and do without water before they budge an inch five starts is insanely high for this company's take it or leave it we are the monopoly style.

name: Lisa Bailey
text:
Super nice ladies in office!!
Appreciate their kindness!
Great company

name: ron brown
text: Great experience. Knowledge staff.

name: Kevin Holt
text: Any issues I have had have  been repaired the day reported or the day after.  I have never had an issue dealing with this company.  Always friendly and professional.

name: Billy Childers
text: There is no way to contact the company on off hours. The web site is for bad. We have a bad water leak caused by road trimmers and the 749 4900 phone number says it is been disconnected or no longer in use. . Don’t know how to contact anyone. Guess I will try to contact the county road trimmers some how but God only knows how.

name: xy zzy (xyzzy603)
text: Worst water company. Turns off water, while holding deposit that is 2-3 times water bill. $50 reconnect fee is a complete rip off. Employees drive company vehicles like they are on a race track. Rude women in office. Glad so see CV19 paid a visit :)

name: Jake Conner
text: wish I could use someone else for my water .. The ladies up front has the worst customer service skills ever. they are ALWAYS rude to me and you can only pay with cash or check. I personally think they should be fired ... wish I didn't have to leave a star in order to leave this comment because they definitely do not deserve it

name: Cindy Hudon
text: Don't keep regular business hours (gone before 5 on Friday). No on line availability and disconnect notices when my bank shows they paid them! Welcome to the new century.  When you walk in the office, it's like being in the 50s!  No letters of credit accepted in lieu of deposit (past experience with utilities for over 30 years!)

name: Marie Don't know
text:
Wasn't near my home.  Made a call, lady at drive-thru window "told me" I had till Sep 24th to pay bill.  Before I could get to there to pay the bill on Sep 24th, they cut my water off and convienently charged me a cut off fee of 50.00.  They refuse to admit their verbal error and not charge the cut-off fee.  They refuse to set up debit card payment or pay by phone.

They are very rude and crude, not professional, act like its their water.  Thought they are suppose to be non-profit....HA !!!

They live in the stone ages....maybe cause of old age.

name: Gripthatruth Hamilton
text: I wish I didn't have to give a star to leave a comment because they don't deserve a star to be so lazy and irresponsible. Customer care over night is a waste of time a money. You guys should fire them because their position is useless!!!!

name: Lisa Heyde
text: Everyone there is very nice and we seldom have any water issues. Would have given a 5star but they need to get with the times and make online payments available. This is the only bill that I have to write a check for because they don't even take debit cards

name: Hurtsboro Outdoors
text: Best customer service EVER!!

name: Heather Cline
text: Worst water company ever

name: Marise Shotts
text: Very friendly and informative.

name: Jennifer Stover
text: I was attempting to give a 1.5 stars, but anyhow. It is what it is

name: Brock Johnson
text: Anytime you go to a place that has a plastic divider between you and "them" its a certainty that customer service will be nonexistent.
